ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Socy 542 is a challenging and engaging theory course. I would recommend this course to anyone who wanted to understand the major players of sociological theory and Dr. Erikson works very hard to make sure that each students understands the content of the course.
I would recommend this course to fellow students. I think this course is an engaging way to learn about sociological theory.
An overview of classical works of sociological theory, including its foundations and development. I would recommend the course to other students.
- Good course, would recommend, though prior familiarity with social theory would probably be an asset

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course will absolutely help me with my research and dissertation, as I was unsure of what theoretical framework was appropriate to my research interests before taking this class.

This course certainly helped me to deepen my knowledge about sociological theory and how to critically engage with theory. I learned about theories that I hadn't really considered applying to my research, as well as gained more knowledge about theories I was already interested in. In particular, the final assignment was useful in helping me to think about the theoretical assumptions of my research interests.
Provided a much better understanding of the field and its foundational thinkers and contributors. In turn, provided the necessary tools and background to continue engagement with the field.
- Gave a broad overview of major theories, general theoretical preparation for field exam - General theoretical preparation for the dissertation
